title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Came in with many dust at the back of the logicboard, magsafe showing dim green light
R6905 is smoking when connected to magsafe,there’s hole on d6905 too
I have replaced r6905, unfortunately i dont have d6905 so i used u6901 from donor board (820-2879), when connect magsafe i have brief green light but after that, suddenly i don’t have any green light (not even dim green light), there’s no voltage at pp18v5 fuse, so this looks like mosfet issue , is q7050 the problem?

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Check diode mode at C6990/99 and F6905.
Be sure the fuse is still good.
Also post exact ohm value R7010/11 and R7001/98.

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Diode mode on c6990 0.189
C6999 0.292
Fuse resistance is 0.3 ohm so, good
R7010 7.3kohm
R7011 7.1kohm
R7001 55kohm
R7098 106kohm

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
" on c6990 0.189 "
No good this...

Remove C6990 and check again.
If still low, replace U6990.

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: C6990 and u6990 replaced, diode mode of c6990 is 0.409 now.., but still no green light

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: Pp18v5 isnt even present, does this mean q7020 is bad?

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
You didn't post diode mode at F6905.

Check if board works with fake charger, or lab power supply.
In such case, leakage issue is bypassed.

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
0.411 diode  mode
nogreen light with fake charger

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
But do you get voltages on the board???
Is better to use a lab power supply, connected through 85W cable.

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: yes, i got 16.5v at ppdcin fuse..

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Only that???

"[B][U]voltages[/U][/B] on the board???"
I expected more readings; at least 3V42 and PPBUS_G3H...

Post U7000 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

Pin 5 16.5v

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: Now, with original magsafe, i got dim green light, but no voltage at dc in fuse, maybe we can fix the leakage issue, then solve the pp3v42 after that..

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Fake charger bypasses the leakage, use it at this moment; untill find the problem.

Q7001 looks bad, or incorrect model.
Be sure to use P-channel MOSFET...

title: 820-2883 no green light

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
after replacing d7005, Macbook boot up fine, but does not (idk see battery / charge the battery ), it say not charging, unplugging magsafe will result in macbook turned off immediately
Looks like not u7000 shunt resistor problem because resistance between pin 17/18 : 2.8 ohm 27/28 is 20.5 ohm
Does any fet cause this? Because i have messed up with the q7050, q7021, and q7020 before

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Ppbus 1.3v with battery only connected
I have tried reballing smc, and i see that ball 34 is gone ( lpc_ad, but i don think it matters..)

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: Okay idk why, but suddenly d6905 blown, i replaced d6905, plug it original magsafe.. no green light, plugged in fake charger, and d6905 blown again..

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
Why did you touch SMC?
And what you did to burn D6905???

If you find a burnt piece, don't you want to find the reason, before applying power?

Now check diode mode at C6990/99.

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
ppvin_g3h_p3v42g3h is shorted, internal shorted because i already lift all caps and component of it, so i construct new path , you can see the picture, now it give a dim green light with blinking yellow light, i have 16.5v on fuse
Im pretty confident with my smc reballing skill.., should be no problem..
Yeah my bad about finding problem before replacing every burn thing..

title: 820-2883 no green light
message: Well i miss pin 6 of u6990 which doesnt give me green light.., now i have steady green light with original magsafe.., back to not seeing battery problem..

title: 820-2883 no green light

title: 820-2883 no green light

title: 820-2883 no green light

title: 820-2883 no green light
message:
8.2V is not correct PPBUS_G3H (without battery).
As voltages and diode mode readings are good on battery bus, then should be SMC, or U7000 problem.
I hope you soldered ISL6258...
